alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 24 at 10:31PM CDT until June 24 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Scott County in east central Iowa... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1031 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Maysville, or near Davenport, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Davenport, Eldridge and Davenport Municipal Airport around 1040 PM CDT. Bettendorf, Riverdale and Panorama Park around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Pleasant Valley, Le Claire and Princeton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
